Text: He who walks with integrity, and does what is righteous, who speaks the truth from his heart,
Context: This verse provides the first set of ethical criteria: living with integrity, acting righteously, and speaking truthful words from the heart.

Text: he who has no slander on his tongue, who does his neighbor no wrong, who casts no scorn on a friend,
Context: Continues listing moral stipulations, emphasizing a controlled tongue, treatment of others, and refraining from slander and scorn.

Text: despicable in his sight is the reprobate, but he honors those who fear the LORD; He makes an oath to his own detriment and does not change.
Context: The verse contrasts the contempt for dishonorable people with honoring those who fear the LORD, highlighting a sense of commitment even when personal loss is involved.

Text: He lends his money without usury and takes no bribe against the innocent. He who does these things will never be shaken.
Context: The closing verse sets forth financial ethics and impartiality as marks of the upright and provides assurance of stability for those who adhere to these principles.
